clinical_study.official_title: Informing and Correcting Perceptions Regarding Tobacco Products Among Young Adults

collaborator.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock:
Objectives:
This 5-year project is concerned with the development and evaluation of a highly innovative mobile phone text messaging project designed to inform young adults about risks associated with conventional and emerging tobacco products. The program's results can inform the Food and Drug Administration's (FDA) leadership, allowing them to make decisions about the text messages that effectively communicate risk to young consumers.

detailed_description.textblock:
Focus Group:
If participant agrees to take part in this study, participant will take part in a focus group about participant's opinion about different tobacco products. Participant will be asked to answer brief questionnaires related to these products, participant's demographic background, health literacy, and questions about the text messages themselves. Each group will have about 6-8 participants. This focus group will be about 2 hours.
Participant's opinion will give researchers ideas about how to develop the text message campaign, provide clues about message content, and learn participant's reactions to the text messages.
The focus group will be audio recorded. Audio files will be saved in MD Anderson data server and securely locked in the office. Audio files will be transcribed (written down) and de-identified within a few weeks or months and then will be destroyed 5 years after the study is completed. The study data will be destroyed 10 years after the study is completed.
Length of Study:
Participation in this study will be over after the focus group.
Health Communication Student Review:
If participant agrees to take part in this study, participant will review of a series of text messages about tobacco products. The researchers would like you to draw upon participant's academic training in the area of health communication to review these messages.
Participant will complete questionnaires about participant's demographics (age, race, sex, and so on), health literacy, and questions about the text messages themselves. This should take about 4 hours to complete.
Pre-test Text Messages:
Participant will review a series of text messages. The text messages contain information about both conventional and new and emerging tobacco products. Participant will be asked 3 questions about each text message. These questions will be about the complexity of the message, how participant thinks the message is framed, and how the message will appeal to the audience.
Length of Study:
Participation in this review will be over after participant completes the questionnaires.
Youth Perception of Tobacco:
Pre-test:
The first part of the study involves answering questions on participant's smartphone using a link the study team will send participant. Participant will be asked some basic descriptive questions about participant, some general health-related questions, and questions about participant's tobacco use. This pre-test survey will take about 30 minutes to complete.
Text Messages - first 30 day period:
After the pre-test, participant will receive 2 text messages a day for 30 days. The text messages will be related to tobacco products and tobacco use. There are 8 different types of messages and participant will be randomly assigned (as in the roll of the dice) to 1 of the 8 types for the 30 day period. Participant will have an equal chance of being in any group. It will take less than a minute per day to read these messages.
Short Weekly Surveys:
During the time participant is receiving the text messages, participant will receive a link to a short survey at the end of each week. The short survey will be related to participant's experiences with the text messages participant received over the previous week. These surveys should take about 5 minutes to complete.
First Post-tests:
Seven (7) days and 3 months after the 30-day text messaging period, participant will be asked to answer more questions on participant's smartphone using a link the study team will send participant. Participant will be asked participant's opinions about the text messages participant received. This will take about 10 minutes.
Text Messages - second 30 day period:
After the 3-month post-test, participant will again receive 2 text messages a day for 30 days. The text messages will be related to tobacco products and tobacco use. There are 8 different type of messages and participant will be randomly assigned to 1 of the 8 types for the 30 day period. It will take less than a minute per day to read these messages.
Second Post-tests:
Seven (7) days and 3 months after the second 30-day text messaging period, participant will be asked to answer more questions on participant's smartphone using a link the study team will send participant. Participant will be asked participant's opinions about the text messages participant received. This will take about 10 minutes.
Reminders:
Participant may receive up to three reminder emails, texts and phone calls for any incomplete short weekly surveys and up to six emails, texts and phone calls for an incomplete perceptions post test and for any incomplete follow up surveys.
Length of Study:
Participant will be on the study for up to 8 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Perceived Risk of Tobacco Products
primary_outcome.description: Focus groups used to assess baseline knowledge and risk perceptions about the use of conventional and new and emerging tobacco products.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Text Messages Related to Tobacco Products and Tobacco Use
primary_outcome.description: Participants review and rate the messages with the goal of achieving 70% agreement among participants across each text message.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Risk Perceptions Related to Tobacco Products
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after last text messaging period
secondary_outcome.description: Researchers hypothesize a higher increase in risk perceptions related to tobacco products seen among those receiving a particular combination of message characteristics than those receiving messages framed with other characteristics.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age 18-25 (Phase 1 and Phase 2)
2. Attend classes at either Houston Community College (HCC) Central Campus or Coleman Campus (Phase 1 and Phase 2) or Spring Branch Campus (Phase 2)
3. Own a smartphone capable of receiving texts from the study's text messaging resource (Phase 1 and Phase 2)
4. Use phone text-messaging features on a regular basis (Phase 1 and Phase 2)
5. Provide cell phone number (Phase 1 and Phase 2)
6. Speak and read English (Phase 1 and Phase 2)
7. Enrolled in a communication program (university student review)
